thread.title: Lady Gaga to duet with Metallica at The Grammys
thread.title_full: Lady Gaga to duet with Metallica at The Grammys | Daily Mail Online

author: Justin Enriquez For Dailymail.com
title: Lady Gaga to duet with Metallica at The Grammys
text:
She received rave reviews for her riveting Super Bowl LI halftime performance.
And it looks like Lady Gaga is ready to rock again.
The 30-year-old singer is set to join Metallica for a duet at The 59th Annual Grammy Awards according to a Tuesday report from Rolling Stone .
In demand: Lady Gaga will perform at The 59th Annual Grammy Awards on Sunday just off her performance at Super Bowl LI
Legends: The singer will be joining Metallica for a duet according to Rolling Stone, as the band is pictured in Hong Kong two weeks ago
The biweekly magazine confirmed the news after a Gaga fan Twitter account posted a video of a snippet of a promo clip which announced: 'Lady Gaga duets with Metallica.'
The Bad Romance hitmaker is a regular at music's biggest night as she performed an inspiring tribute to David Bowie at last year's event.
She is also no stranger to collaborations at The Grammys as she was joined by Tony Bennett as they performed Cheek To Cheek in 2015.
Dynamic duo: The 30-year-old singer is no stranger to the award show as she performed Cheek To Cheek with Tony Bennett in 2015
Metallica last performed on the show in 2014 as they did their classic One with world famous concert pianist Lang Lang.
There are more collaborations slated for the gala event as The Weeknd is set to perform with collaborators Daft Punk and Alicia Keys will join forces with country singer Maren Morris.
The 59th annual Grammy Awards hosted by James Corden is set to air Sunday at 8pm EST on CBS.
Fade To Black: Metallica (pictured: singer/guitarist James Hetfield in Denmark on Friday) last performed on the show in 2014 as they did their classic One with world famous concert pianist Lang Lang
It has been a busy week for Gaga as she was heavily praised for her highly-energetic and ambitious 13-minute performance at the Super Bowl on Sunday night.
The singer - real name Stefani Joanne Angelina Germanotta - also took to Twitter later on that night to announce her upcoming Joanne World Tour.
She kept the declaration very simple by posting a .GIF featuring her with circular shades that had 'Joanne' flashed across them.
Shining star: It has been a busy week for Gaga as she was heavily praised for her highly-energetic and ambitious 13-minute performance at the Super Bowl on Sunday night
Gaga is no stranger to the road as this will be her sixth tour in her near decade in the spotlight.
Her last tour was from late 2014 through August 2015 as she was on the Cheek To Cheek Tour alongside the legendary Tony Bennett.
Coming soon: Shortly after the halftime show the singer - real name Stefani Joanne Angelina Germanotta - took to Twitter on Sunday night to announce her upcoming Joanne World Tour
